location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically in two sections.
Foliation: this file has foliation numbers in the top right hand corner of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence relating to the making of official calls to Bahrain by British ships and the Political Resident Persian Gulf. Letters describe how calls were exchanged British officials and and the Shaikh of Bahrain. Correspondence discusses how the firing of military salutes was suspended for the duration of World War Two. Correspondents include the Political Agent, Bahrain; Political Resident in the Persian Gulf; Shaikh Hamad bin Isa al Khalifah, Ruler of Sharjah.
